node.title: Hundreds of Google Employees Encourage Co-Workers to Resist Company's Vaccine Mandate
node.alt: Google are protesting a rule that says unvaccinated employees cannot return to the office. Above is the Googleplex, headquarters of Google Inc. in Mountain View, California, April 7, 2017.
node.description: "I do not believe Google should be privy to the health and medical history of Googlers and the vaccination status is no exception," the manifesto states.
node.content:
["At least 600 Google employees have signed a manifesto calling on co-workers to resist a vaccine mandate requirement and for management to implement a new one that is \"inclusive of all Googlers,\" telling them to \"oppose the mandate as a matter of principle\" CNBC reports.", "The manifesto comes as a December 3 deadline draws near for employees to upload their vaccination status and whether they intend to return to the office to a company portal. By January 10, all employees must report to the physical office at least three days a week.", "The Biden administration ordered that companies with more than 100 employees must require full vaccination or regular testing by January 4. Google has ordered that all employees who work directly or indirectly with government contracts must receive vaccination, without testing being an option. The manifesto authors call this \"coercive,\" and \"the antithesis of inclusion.\"", "\"I do not believe Google should be privy to the health and medical history of Googlers and the vaccination status is no exception,\" the manifesto states.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available.", "", "
Google are protesting a rule that says unvaccinated employees cannot return to the office. Above is the Googleplex, headquarters of Google Inc. in Mountain View, California, April 7, 2017.
"]
